intro: Pycnocycla macrocarpa, commonly known as the Florida hickory, is a deciduous tree native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Betulaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and edible nuts. The tree produces small, yellowish-green flowers in early spring, followed by oval-shaped, woody fruits. Its bark is thick and scaly, providing some resistance to fire and insects. The plant plays an important ecological role in providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
